Articles.Content:
Last weekend's progress. Finished the body and attached everything together.... Will have to paint the spacesuit and a second coat of hair. Not happy with the mouth yet, any suggestions on how to make it look better?

Also, words of appreciation/encouragement for my wife would be greatly appreciated...

[Quarter on right foot to scale the kerbal]

Hey! So my wife has taken up crochet as a hobby recently.... I gave her dimensions for a full size kerbal and she's been hard at work making Jebbie during the weekends. This is last weekend's progress...What do you guys think? I helped out spray painting the hair and she did all the crocheting... We were curious, how much will you be willing to pay for a full-size kerbal desk puppet?, we were wondering what people are willing to pay for a kerbal on their office desk.... We are also designing a kerbal to hang off of the car rear-view mirror and a key-fob sized one, let us know if you would like to get one for yourself....

I'm attaching a few pics of our progress, will post more later this week....

[First attempt at a mouth, planning to change it to make it look better]

Edited January 29, 2015 by Mechie_PhD

I'm shocked nobody else has responded

I love it, it's adorable! Actually somewhat moreso without the mouth. You might want to make that look better.

I'm shocked nobody else has responded

I love it, it's adorable! Actually somewhat moreso without the mouth. You might want to make that look better.

Thank you, Heartstrings.... Still working on the mouth, do you have any ideas to make it look better?

I'm more around the area of 15-20 dollars for one of these.

i would kill for one for my key fob. or one to hang off my backpack.

they look adorable though.
This is really cool! I'd pay to have little Jebarooney on my backpack.
Love it! I would defiantly love to buy one.
Keep that flammable yarn away from rocket fuel, we know how jeb likes his propellants.
